G.T.5320
SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - EVENING - 3rd AUGUST, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
(a) French Front. Between REIMS and SOISSONS the French have made considerable progress on the Eastern and Western flanks but in the centre progress has been appreciably slower. On the right French Cavalry have reached the VESLE between CHAMPIGNY and JONCHERRY.
It is reported that the bridges across the VESLE have been destroyed between these places.
The Infantry hold the following line:- MONT ST PIERRE (West of TINQUES) - HILL 114 (West of CHAMPIGNY) - THILLOIS - GUEUX - ROSNAY - MONTAZIN FARM (West of ROSNAY) - SAVIGNY - CHATEAU DE PRIU.
The exact line between ARDRE and LOUPEIGNE is indefinite. North of LOUPEIGNE the French are making progress in the direction of TANNIERES and their advance guards have reached CORCEUIL and COURVELLES.
Between VENIZEL and POMMIERS the French hold the Southern Bank of the AISNE.
The town of FISHES is on fire and there are numerous fires in the whole valley of the VESLE. Fires have also been observed North West of REIMS in the region of MUIZON and ST THIERRY.
(b) British Front. It is confirmed that the enemy have withdrawn to the Eastern bank of the ANCRE between ALBERT and HAMEL. The situation in ALBERT is unknown.
2. ITALIAN AND MACEDONIAN FRONTS.
There is nothing to report.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
Issued at 6.25 p.m.
August 3rd, 1918.
